item.title: Pokemon Go Unova Tour In LA Will Go On, But Refunds Are Being Offered
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-unova-tour-in-la-will-go-on-but-refunds-are-being-offered/1100-6529247/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

During the first week of the Los Angeles wildfires, Niantic assured fans that its Pokemon Go Unova Tour - Los Angeles event will go on as scheduled. Nearly a month later, that's still the plan. However, Niantic is also extending a refund offer to ticket holders who won't be able to make the event.

Niantic shared the news on the official Pokemon Go site, and added that players who choose to take the refund can make the request via in-app support through February 23.

The Pokemon Go: Unova Tour - Los Angeles will be held at the Rose Bowl Stadium in Pasadena on February 21-23. There will also be citywide gameplay in Los Angeles and Orange County. The event will also mark the Pokemon Go debut of Black Kyurem and White Kyurem ahead of their global rollout on March 1.

Niantic recently announced the rest of the Pokemon Go events for February, as well as what's planned before the global Pokemon Go Tour: Unova event on March 1-2. In other Pokemon news outside of the mobile game, the Japanese mob is reportedly using Pokemon cards to launder money, while a former US postal worker recently pled guilty to stealing $100,000 worth of Pokemon cards and other collectibles. And one Pokemon TCG Pocket Player in Japan appears to have spent a ridiculous amount of money on the game's virtual cards.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny Gets A Modern Remaster This Year
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/onimusha-2-samurais-destiny-gets-a-modern-remaster-this-year/1100-6529245/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Capcom has announced that Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny is being remastered for PC, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox One. The remaster is due out sometime in 2025.

Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny follows Jubei Yagyu as he fights against a demon army led by Nobunaga Oda. After Nobunaga's army slaughtered the Yagyu clan, Jubei is now on a quest for revenge. Along the way, Jubei meets others with similar goals and learns more about his oni heritage, which gives him powers to defeat Nobunaga's demons.

The game was first released for PS2 in 2002, and it's the second entry in the series to get a modern remaster. Back in 2018, Capcom remastered the first game in the series, Onimusha: Warlords.

Capcom is currently working on the first new mainline entry in the series since 2006, titled Onimusha: Way of the Sword. While its platforms haven't been revealed yet, the game is slated to release sometime in 2026.

Producer Akihito Kadokwaki also recently provided some new info about the game, saying that it will focus on three core aspects. They include creating compelling characters, bringing the Kyoto setting to life, and delivering "the ultimate swordfighting action."

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
